name: scripts/index.js
content:
'use strict'

import { config } from './libs/config.js'
import { store } from './libs/store.js'

import { Device } from './libs/device.js'

import { Router } from './libs/router.js'

import { Communication } from './libs/communication'
import { Component } from './libs/component'
import { Module } from './libs/module.js'

import { approx } from './utils/approx.js'
import { cookie } from './utils/cookie.js'
import { DateTime } from './utils/datetime.js'
import { extend } from './utils/extend.js'
import { font } from './utils/font.js'
import { getter } from './utils/getter.js'
import { html } from './utils/html.js'
import { isNumber } from './utils/isnumber.js'
import { isObject } from './utils/isobject.js'
import { loader } from './utils/loader.js'
import { logger } from './utils/logger.js'
import { loop } from './utils/loop.js'
import { radians } from './utils/radians.js'
import { rnd } from './utils/rnd.js'
import { scroll } from './utils/scroll.js'
import { setter } from './utils/setter.js'
import { sounds } from './utils/sounds.js'
import { uid } from './utils/uid.js'

export {
  config,
  store,

  Device,

  Router,

  Communication,
  Component,
  Module,

  approx, cookie, DateTime, extend, font, getter, html, isNumber, isObject, loader, logger, loop, radians, rnd, scroll, setter, sounds, uid
}

name: scripts/libs/communication.js
Communication
description: This class is responsible for server communication using http requests

name: constructor
description: Creates an instance of Communication

params.name: form
params.description: An existing form that would be sent

name: __form
description: The FormData to use when sending the request

name: __request
description: The XMLHttpRequest to use in the request

name: __headers
description: Contains all the headers for the request

name: addField
description: Adds a field to the request

name: addFields
description: Adds a list of fields to the request

params.name: fields
params.description: The object properties become the parameters and the values are the parameter values

name: setHeader
description: Sets a header to the request

name: listener
description: Sets a listener to track the progress of the request

params.name: progress
params.description: This function has one parameter representing the progress value

params.name: end
params.description: This function has one parameter which contains the responseText

name: parseUrl
description: Parse a url to the correct format

name: cancel
description: Abort a request

name: send
description: Initiate the request

name: post
description: Initiate a POST request

name: get
description: Initiate a GET request

name: scripts/libs/component.js
Component
description: This class is used to create web components

name: template
description: The html string that becomes the view for this component

name: onStateChange
description: The method gets called whenever the state changes

name: onResize
description: The method gets called whenever the container is resized

name: execute
description: The method gets called when the component gets created in the page. It is the main method of the class

name: terminate
description: The method gets called when the component calls destroy(). It can be used to remove handlers or clear timeouts

name: constructor
description: Creates an instance of Component

name: uid
description: A unique identifier

name: parent
description: The parent wrapper

name: element
description: The component view

name: config
description: The config class of the module parent

name: store
description: The store class of the module parent

name: __stateWatcher
description: The __stateWatcher is a handler for the router, it gets destroyed when the component gets destroyed

name: __resizeWatcher
description: Determines if the component watches for resize changes in parent dimensions

name: __onStateChange
description: The method gets called whenever the state changes

name: __onResize
description: The method gets called whenever the container is resized

name: __destroy
description: The method gets called when the component is destroyed

name: scripts/libs/config.js
config
description: Instance of Config to be used as singleton

name: Config
description: Class holding static configuration

name: constructor
description: Creates an instance of Config

name: __configuration
description: Contains all the configuration data

name: set
description: Sets data in configuration

params.name: key
params.description: You can use sub data by concatenating strings with '.', eg: employee.name.firstname

name: get
description: Gets data from configuration

params.name: key
params.description: You can use sub data by concatenating strings with '.', eg: employee.name.firstname

name: create
description: Returns an instance of Config

name: scripts/libs/device.js
Device
description: Class used to get device information

name: constructor
description: Creates an instance of Device

name: __handlerListener
description: Calls all the handlers bound to the window resize

name: __handlerResize
description: The handler for resize

name: __handlerBound
description: Determines if any handlers are bound

name: __device
description: Holds the device type

name: __listeners
description: Holds all the handlers bound

name: onResize
description: Method used to attach a handler to the on resize event. Returns a function that can be called to remove the handler at a further date

params.name: listener
params.description: A function containing one parameter which can be "landscape" or "portrait"

name: type
description: Returns the device name

name: isDesktop
description: Returns true if the device is a desktop

name: isMobile
description: Returns true if the device is a mobile device

name: scripts/libs/module.js
_attrComponent
description: The attribute name used to determine if an HTMLElement is a component

name: _attrLink
description: The attribute name used to determine if an HTMLElement ( usually an anchor tag ) is a state change component. This will prevent server reload on anchor tags.

name: linkHandler
description: A shorthand for the link element handler

name: Module
description: The main class, used to create a Modux module. You can think of this as the main application

name: addDependency
description: A method used to add components to the Module

params.name: name
params.description: The name under which the Component will be known as

name: removeDependency
description: A method used to remove components from the Module

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the Component to be removed

name: constructor
description: Creates an instance of Module

params.name: name
params.description: A unique name for the application, for easier management

name: __name
description: A unique name for the application, for easier management

name: __dependencies
description: Contains all the components added to the module

name: __config
description: Contains a new instance of Config which is passed on to all components

name: __store
description: Contains a new instance of Store which is passed on to all components

name: __createComponent
description: Creates a component on an HTMLElement if it doesn't have one already

params.name: element
params.description: The HTMLElement to bind the Component to

name: __removeComponent
description: Removes a component from an HTMLElement if it has one

params.name: element
params.description: The HTMLElement for which we want to remove the Component

name: __createComponentLink
description: Creates a link component on an HTMLElement if it doesn't have one already

params.name: element
params.description: The HTMLElement to bind the link to

name: __removeComponentLink
description: Removes a link component from an HTMLElement if it has one

params.name: element
params.description: The HTMLElement for which we want to remove the link

name: __loopOnElements
description: Checks if the current element needs a Component instance

params.name: attr
params.description: The attribute to watch out for

params.name: handler
params.description: The callback function which will be called after the checks are made

name: bootstrap
description: Initializes the Module on a specific HTMLElement and loads the specified Component for it

params.name: element
params.description: The HTMLElement used as the wrapper for the Module

params.name: component
params.description: The Component to be used as the main Component

name: __htmlWatcher
description: Holds the MutationObserver which is used to check for changes in the DOM

name: __component
description: Holds the main Component which is used for the Module.

name: destroy
description: Destroy the current module. This will also destroy all the components created and disconnect the MutationObserver

name: scripts/libs/router.js
baseEnabled
description: If set to true it will change the base tag every time a redirect occurs

name: listeners
description: Holds all the handlers bound to the router class. Since the class is static, all imports will point to the same class

name: handler
description: This function is used to call all handlers on url or state change

name: pushState
description: This variable is a shorthand for history.pushState

name: pushState
description: Add a new method to history, to call use when the state or url changes

name: Router
description: A static class which is responsible for handling state and url change

name: setDynamicBase
description: Determines if the base tag is modified each time a redirect occurs

params.name: enabled
params.description: If true the base tag will be updated each time the pathname changes in the application

name: redirect
description: A static method used to push a new state

name: onStateChange
description: A static method used to attach a handler to the state change. It returns a function that can be called to remove the handler when it is no longer used

name: scripts/libs/store.js
store
description: Instance of Store to be used as singleton

name: Store
description: A store class used to communicate between components

name: constructor
description: Creates an instance of Store

name: __listeners
description: Contains all the listeners subscribed to the store

name: __data
description: Contains all the data sent to the store. Is used when a handler is attached after the data has already been pushed.

name: on
description: Method used to bind handlers to the store

params.name: showPreviousData
params.description: Set to true if data is to be sent to the handler upon attachment, if set to false it will work as a standard event handler

return.description: Call this function to unsubscribe from the event

name: emit
description: Emits data on a specific event name. Accepts multiple parameters. The first parameter will be the event name and all the following params will be pushed on the event name

name: create
description: Returns an instance of Store

approx

params.name: decimals

return.description: A new number

name: getCookie

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the cookie to be retrieved

description: Returns cookie manipulation functions

name: scripts/utils/datetime.js
DateTime

name: toString
description: Return the date and time in the YYYY-mm-DD HH:MM:ss format

name: toTime
description: Returns the date and time in the HH:MM:ss format

name: toDate
description: Returns the date and time in the YYYY-mm-DD format

name: elapsedTime
description: Returns the milliseconds since the date was created to now

name: scripts/utils/extend.js
extend
description: Extends an object with another object

return.description: Returns the source object

name: scripts/utils/font.js
content: /* globals document */ 'use strict' import { html } from './html.js' import { loop } from './loop.js' /** * Creates a font test container * @param {String} name The name of the container * @return {HTMLElement} The html tag containing the test text */ let createContainer = ( name ) => { let e = html( ` abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz 1234567890 ABCDEFGHIGKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ !? -_ ` ) return e } /** * Create an empty style tag containing the font to be used in testing. Uses Adobe Blank font * @external {Adobe Blank} https://github.com/adobe-fonts/adobe-blank * @return {HTMLElement} The style tag which contains the font name */ let createBlankFont = () => { let e = html( ` ` ) return e } /** * A function to check if a font has been loaded * @param {String} font The font name to be loaded * @param {Object} styles The styles to load, bold, italic, etc... * @param {Number} interval The time in milliseconds it takes to retry the load * @param {Number} attempts The number of attempts before the promise is rejected * @return {Promise} A promise that is resolved when the font is loaded */ export let font = ( font, styles, interval, attempts ) => { let blank = createBlankFont() document.getElementsByTagName( 'head' )[0].appendChild( blank ) let container = createContainer( font ) document.body.appendChild( container ) container.style.fontFamily = '"' + font + '", "AdobeBlank"' loop( styles, ( value, key ) => { container.style[ key ] = value } ) let count = 0 return new Promise( ( resolve, reject ) => { let cleanUp = () => { container.parentNode.removeChild( container ) blank.remove() } let timer = () => { if ( container.offsetWidth > 0 ) { cleanUp() resolve() } else { count++ if ( count === attempts ) { cleanUp() reject() } else { setTimeout( timer, interval || 100 ) } } } // Delay to allow AdobeBlank font to load setTimeout( () => { timer() }, 500 ) } ) }

name: createContainer
description: Creates a font test container

return.description: The html tag containing the test text

name: Adobe Blank
description: Create an empty style tag containing the font to be used in testing. Uses Adobe Blank font

return.description: The style tag which contains the font name

name: font
description: A function to check if a font has been loaded

params.name: font
params.description: The font name to be loaded

params.name: styles
params.description: The styles to load, bold, italic, etc...

params.name: interval
params.description: The time in milliseconds it takes to retry the load

params.name: attempts
params.description: The number of attempts before the promise is rejected

return.description: A promise that is resolved when the font is loaded

name: scripts/utils/getter.js
getValueFromObject
description: Used to return a deep value from an Object. Without any checks.

name: getter
description: Used to return a deep value from an Object. Use the "." separator to check subobjects

params.name: key
params.description: The key to check the value for

return.description: Returns the value for the key in the collection

name: scripts/utils/html.js
html
description: Convert string to html

name: scripts/utils/isnumber.js
content:
'use strict'

/**
 * Checks if the value is a number
 * @param {mixed} value The value to be checked if it's a number
 * @return {Boolean} Returns true if value is a number
 */
export let isNumber = value => ( Number( parseFloat( value ) ) === value )

name: isNumber
description: Checks if the value is a number

params.name: value
params.description: The value to be checked if it's a number

return.description: Returns true if value is a number

name: scripts/utils/isobject.js
content:
'use strict'

/**
 * Checks if the object is an Object
 * @param {mixed} o The value to be checked if its an Object
 * @return {Boolean} Returns true if the value is an Object
 */
export let isObject = o => !Array.isArray( o ) && o !== null && typeof o === 'object' && Object.prototype.toString.call( o ) === '[object Object]'

name: isObject
description: Checks if the object is an Object

params.name: o
params.description: The value to be checked if its an Object

return.description: Returns true if the value is an Object

name: scripts/utils/radians.js
content:
'use strict'

/**
 * Convert an angle from degrees to radians
 * @param {Numeric} angle The angle in degrees
 * @return {Numeric} The angle in radians
 */
export let radians = ( angle ) => angle * Math.PI / 180

name: radians

return.description: The angle in radians

content:
# modux
A framework used in front end application creation

## Installation

```
npm install CrispCode/modux#v2 --save-dev
```

## How to use

Add to your package.json scripts:
```
  "scripts": {
    "test": "NODE_ENV=development ./node_modules/.bin/webpack-dev-server --open --config ./node_modules/modux/webpack.config.js",
    "build": "NODE_ENV=production ./node_modules/.bin/webpack --config ./node_modules/modux/webpack.config.js"
  }
```

To run use: `npm test` or `npm run build`

## Polyfill

In order to support older versions of browsers, you can use polyfills:

```
    <script crossorigin="anonymous" src="https://polyfill.io/v3/polyfill.min.js?flags=gated&features=default%2CMutationObserver%2CString.prototype.padStart%2Cconsole.info"></script>
```

## Modux classes

  |Name|Usage|Description|
  |:---:|---|---|
  | config | `import { config } from 'modux'` | A class containing the configuration |
  | store | `import { store } from 'modux'` | A class used to communicate between components |
  | Device | `import { Device } from 'modux'` | A class used to determine device |
  | Router | `import { Router } from 'modux'` | A static class used to manipulate states and urls |
  | Communication | `import { Communication } from 'modux'` | The Communication class, used to handler http requests |
  | Component | `import { Component } from 'modux'` | The Component class. Components are the backbone of the application |
  | Module | `import { Module } from 'modux'` | The Module class. Modules are the main part of modux |

## Utils classes

  |Name|Usage|Description|
  |:---:|---|---|
  | approx | `import { approx } from 'modux'` | Used to approximate a number to a certain number of decimals |
  | cookie | `import { cookie } from 'modux'` | Contains cookie manipulation functions |
  | DateTime | `import { DateTime } from 'modux'` | A Date class wrapper |
  | extend | `import { extend } from 'modux'` | Extends an object with another object |
  | font | `import { font } from 'modux'` | A font loader |
  | getter | `import { getter } from 'modux'` | Used to return a deep value from an Object. Use the "." separator to check subobjects |
  | html | `import { html } from 'modux'` | Convert string to html |
  | isNumber | `import { isNumber } from 'modux'` | Checks if the value is a number |
  | isObject | `import { isObject } from 'modux'` | Checks if the object is an Object |
  | loader | `import { loader } from 'modux'` | The Loader class is used to preload files |
  | logger | `import { logger } from 'modux'` | A wrapper for window.console |
  | loop | `import { loop } from 'modux'` | Loop through a collection Object or Array |
  | radians | `import { radians } from 'modux'` | Convert an angle from degrees to radians |
  | rnd | `import { rnd } from 'modux'` | Generate a random number between two values |
  | scroll | `import { scroll } from 'modux'` | A library used for scrolling window or an element |
  | setter | `import { setter } from 'modux'` | Used to set a deep value from an Object |
  | Sounds | `import { sonds } from 'modux'` | A class used to manipulate Sounds |
  | uid | `import { uid } from 'modux'` | Generates a random unique identifier |
name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "modux",
  "version": "2.0.0",
  "description": "A framework used in front end application creation",
  "author": "Crisp Code ( contact@crispcode.ro )",
  "engines": {
    "node": ">=8.0.0",
    "npm": ">=5.0.0"
  },
  "license": "SEE LICENSE IN LICENSE",
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "https://github.com/CrispCode/modux.git"
  },
  "bugs": {
    "url": "https://github.com/CrispCode/modux/issues"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@babel/core": "^7.2.2",
    "@babel/plugin-proposal-object-rest-spread": "^7.2.0",
    "@babel/preset-env": "^7.2.3",
    "@babel/register": "^7.0.0",
    "babel-loader": "^8.0.4",
    "copy-webpack-plugin": "^4.5.3",
    "css-loader": "^2.0.2",
    "eslint": "^5.11.0",
    "file-loader": "^3.0.1",
    "html-webpack-plugin": "^3.2.0",
    "imagemin-webpack-plugin": "^2.4.0",
    "mini-css-extract-plugin": "^0.5.0",
    "node-sass": "^4.11.0",
    "raw-loader": "^1.0.0",
    "sass-loader": "^7.1.0",
    "speed-measure-webpack-plugin": "^1.3.0",
    "uglifyjs-webpack-plugin": "^2.1.0",
    "url-loader": "^1.1.2",
    "webpack": "^4.28.2",
    "webpack-cli": "^3.1.2",
    "webpack-dev-server": "^3.1.14"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0"
  },
  "main": "./scripts/index.js",
  "scripts": {
    "test": "cd test && NODE_ENV=development ./../node_modules/.bin/webpack-dev-server --open --config ./../webpack.config.js",
    "test-build": "cd test && NODE_ENV=production ./../node_modules/.bin/webpack --config ./../webpack.config.js",
    "docs": "rm -rf ./docs && ./node_modules/.bin/esdoc && open ./docs/index.html"
  }
}
name: package.json

content:
# modux
A framework used in front end application creation

## Installation

```
npm install CrispCode/modux#v2 --save-dev
```

## How to use

Add to your package.json scripts:
```
  "scripts": {
    "test": "NODE_ENV=development ./node_modules/.bin/webpack-dev-server --open --config ./node_modules/modux/webpack.config.js",
    "build": "NODE_ENV=production ./node_modules/.bin/webpack --config ./node_modules/modux/webpack.config.js"
  }
```

To run use: `npm test` or `npm run build`

## Polyfill

In order to support older versions of browsers, you can use polyfills:

```
    <script crossorigin="anonymous" src="https://polyfill.io/v3/polyfill.min.js?flags=gated&features=default%2CMutationObserver%2CString.prototype.padStart%2Cconsole.info"></script>
```

## Modux classes

  |Name|Usage|Description|
  |:---:|---|---|
  | config | `import { config } from 'modux'` | A class containing the configuration |
  | store | `import { store } from 'modux'` | A class used to communicate between components |
  | Device | `import { Device } from 'modux'` | A class used to determine device |
  | Router | `import { Router } from 'modux'` | A static class used to manipulate states and urls |
  | Communication | `import { Communication } from 'modux'` | The Communication class, used to handler http requests |
  | Component | `import { Component } from 'modux'` | The Component class. Components are the backbone of the application |
  | Module | `import { Module } from 'modux'` | The Module class. Modules are the main part of modux |

## Utils classes

  |Name|Usage|Description|
  |:---:|---|---|
  | approx | `import { approx } from 'modux'` | Used to approximate a number to a certain number of decimals |
  | cookie | `import { cookie } from 'modux'` | Contains cookie manipulation functions |
  | DateTime | `import { DateTime } from 'modux'` | A Date class wrapper |
  | extend | `import { extend } from 'modux'` | Extends an object with another object |
  | font | `import { font } from 'modux'` | A font loader |
  | getter | `import { getter } from 'modux'` | Used to return a deep value from an Object. Use the "." separator to check subobjects |
  | html | `import { html } from 'modux'` | Convert string to html |
  | isNumber | `import { isNumber } from 'modux'` | Checks if the value is a number |
  | isObject | `import { isObject } from 'modux'` | Checks if the object is an Object |
  | loader | `import { loader } from 'modux'` | The Loader class is used to preload files |
  | logger | `import { logger } from 'modux'` | A wrapper for window.console |
  | loop | `import { loop } from 'modux'` | Loop through a collection Object or Array |
  | radians | `import { radians } from 'modux'` | Convert an angle from degrees to radians |
  | rnd | `import { rnd } from 'modux'` | Generate a random number between two values |
  | scroll | `import { scroll } from 'modux'` | A library used for scrolling window or an element |
  | setter | `import { setter } from 'modux'` | Used to set a deep value from an Object |
  | Sounds | `import { sonds } from 'modux'` | A class used to manipulate Sounds |
  | uid | `import { uid } from 'modux'` | Generates a random unique identifier |
